briefdescription.para: Filename for module to read an image directly.
camera image input message
camera image output message
The name of the CameraConfigMsg output message.
The name of the directory to save images.
[ns] Current time tag for sensor out
[-] 1 to save images to file for debugging
[-] Name of the parent body to which the camera should be attached
[-] Is the camera currently taking images
[-] Is the camera currently taking images
[-] Camera resolution, width/height in pixels (pixelWidth/pixelHeight in Unity) in pixels
[ns] Frame time interval at which to capture images in units of nanosecond
[r] camera y-axis field of view edge-to-edge
[m] Camera position in body frame
[-] MRP defining the orientation of the camera frame relative to the body frame
[-] name of skyboz in use
Enable post-processing of camera image. Value of 0 (protobuffer default) to use viz default which is off, -1 for false, 1 for true.
Distance to the point of focus, minimum value of 0.1, Value of 0 to turn off this parameter entirely.
Ratio of the aperture (known as f-stop or f-number). The smaller the value is, the shallower the depth of field is. Valid Setting Range: 0.05 to 32. Value of 0 to turn off this parameter entirely.
[m] Valid setting range: 0.001m to 0.3m. Value of 0 to turn off this parameter entirely.

Convolution kernel size of the bokeh filter, which determines the maximum radius of bokeh. It also affects the performance (the larger the kernel is, the longer the GPU time is required). Depth textures Value of 1 for Small, 2 for Medium, 3 for Large, 4 for Extra Large. Value of 0 to turn off this parameter entirely.
Gaussian noise level.
Dark current intensity.
Stuck and Dark pixels probability.
Random cosmic rays (number)
Blur over image in pixels.
(double) HSV color correction, H (-pi/pi) hue shift, S and V are percent multipliers
(int) BGR color correction values as percent
BSK Logging
void pointer for image memory passing

detaileddescription.para: The constructor for the Camera module. It also sets some default values at its creation.

This module reads an OpNav image and extracts circle information from its content using OpenCV's HoughCircle Transform. It performs a greyscale, a bur, and a threshold on the image to facilitate circle-finding.
void
CurrentSimNanos
The clock time at which the function was called (nanoseconds)

listitem.para: Update the camera config data no matter if an image is present
Recast image pointer to CV type

inbodydescription.para: If the permanent image buffer is not populated, it will be equal to null

listitem.para: Encode the cv mat into a png for the future modules to decode it the same way
If no image is present, write zeros in message

detaileddescription.para:
This method performs a complete reset of the module. Local module variables that retain time varying states between function calls are reset to their default values.
void
CurrentSimNanos
current time (ns)

Adjusts the HSV values of each pixel. Can be used to shift the hue, saturation, and brightness of an image.
mSrc
source image
mDst
destination of modified image
void

Adjusts the BGR values of each pixel by a percent value. Can be used to simulate a sensor with different sensitivities to B, G, and R.
mSrc
source image
mDst
destination of modified image
void

Adds gaussian noise to an image. Can be used to add color noise and dark current.
mSrc
source image
mDst
destination of modified image
Mean
mean pixel value
StdDev
standard deviation of pixel value
void

inbodydescription.para: Generates random noise in a normal distribution.
Adds the noise layer to the image layer with a weighted add to prevent overflowing the pixels.

detaileddescription.para:
Adds dead and hot pixels to an image.
mSrc
source image
mDst
destination of modified image
pa
probability of dead pixels
pb
probability of hot pixels
void

inbodydescription.para: These lines will make the hot and dead pixels different every time.
This line makes the hot and dead pixels the same frame to frame.
Determines the amount of hot/dead pixels based on the input probabilities.
Chooses random pixels to be stuck or dead in the amount calculated previously.

detaileddescription.para:
Adds a cosmic ray to an image. The ray is modelled as a single pixel wide white line.
mSrc
source image
mDst
destination of modified image
probThreshhold
probability of getting a ray each frame
randOffset
if adding multiple rays pass in the number of each to guarantee a random ray
maxSize
max length of cosmic ray
void

inbodydescription.para: Uses the current sim time and the random offset to ensure a different ray every time.
Chooses a random point on the image. Then chooses a second random point within 50 pixels in either direction.

detaileddescription.para:
Adds a user specified number of cosmic rays to an image. Rays are modelled as a single pixel wide white line. The maximum length is hard-coded as 50 pixels.
mSrc
source image
mDst
destination of modified image
num
number of cosmic rays to be added
void

inbodydescription.para: Threshold defined such that 1 provides a 1/50 chance of getting a ray, and 10 will get about 5 rays per image
Currently length is limited to 50 pixels

memberdef.argsstring: (cv::Mat, cv::Mat &mDst, double gaussian, double darkCurrent, double saltPepper, double cosmicRays, double blurparam)
memberdef.name: ApplyFilters

detaileddescription.para:
Applys all of the various pertubations to an image with user specified levels. Each parameter is a double scaling actor. A parameter of 0 will result in the respective perturbation not being applied.
mSource
source image
mDst
destination of modified image
gaussian
scaling factor for gaussian noise
darkCurrent
scaling factor for dark current
saltPepper
scaling factor for hot and dead pixels
cosmicRays
number of cosmic rays to add
blurparam
size of blur to apply
void

briefdescription.para: visual camera class
